intro: Hieracium pseudoleiopsis, commonly known as the false leopard's bread. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its dandelion-like yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in a single head. Hieracium pseudoleiopsis is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
